title: Aen 10 846-849 - SS sight - line 2 - Gram - result

content.description:
A Father Addresses His Son

Tantane me tenuit vivendi, nate, voluptas, 
ut pro me hostilihostilis, -e, adj. = inimicus, -a, -um paterer succederesuccedo, -ere (+ dat.): to succumb to dextrae, 
quem genuigigno, -ere, genui: to bear? Tuane haec genitorgenitor, -oris, m. = pater, -tris per vulnera servor 
morte tua vivens?
content.question: In line 2, what grammatical construction is introduced by ut?

unit.text: 6: Course Project and Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
